column3: Normal, specific and total mass shift constants and the product of the field shift constant and the deviation in mean-square nuclear radii [Berengut:2003:022502]

column11: Specific mass shift constant derived from data of Matsubara:2003:209. Field shift here is that for 67-66 and is derived by scaling F*d<r^2> for 66-64 by the 67-66 vs. 66-64 relative d<r^2> value from Campbell:1997:2351.

Specific mass shift is that calculated by Berengut:2003:022502, scaled up by the ratio of the calculated-vs.-measured specific mass shift values for the 2026 line. Field shift assumed to be the same as for 2026 line – calculations of Berengut:2003:022502 justify this.

Specific mass shift is that calculated by Berengut:2003:022502, scaled up by the ratio of the calculated-vs.-measured specific mass shift values for the 2026 line. Field shift assumed to be the same as for 2026 line – calculations of Berengut:2003:022502 justify this.

Specific mass shift is that calculated by Berengut:2003:022502, scaled up by the ratio of the calculated-vs.-measured specific mass shift values for the 2026 line. Field shift assumed to be the same as for 2026 line – calculations of Berengut:2003:022502 justify this.

Specific mass shift is that calculated by Berengut:2003:022502, scaled up by the ratio of the calculated-vs.-measured specific mass shift values for the 2026 line. Field shift assumed to be the same as for 2026 line – calculations of Berengut:2003:022502 justify this.
